resources.string: Pwnie Express Network Minder
It\'s dangerous out there! Use the Network Minder to watch for risky connections which may be malicious

Did you know that all of your old WiFi connections are stored? This information can be used to spin up malicious access points known as Evil APs. Use the network minder to clean up old networks and alert you if an Evil AP appears in your immediate area.
Do you run a business network? Know EXACTLY what risks your users are introducing through automated device risk scoring, provided through our companion Pulse Platform.
See Your Connections
Next
On the go and need to use Wifi?
Spring Cleaning aint just for your closets
Know what you\'re getting when they connect

You should immediately disconnect from this network. If possible, turn off WiFi and use other connection means (cellular, wired) to regain connectivity. You should immediately cease any and all sensitive transactions (banking, shopping, personal email) unless you are running a VPN or other security mechanism. Use the \'Previous Networks\' Tab to delete networks you no longer need.

“Evil AP” refers to the collection of software tools and appropriate hardware which is indistinguishable from a legitimate WiFi network (i.e. ‘FreeWifi’ or ‘LoganAirportWiFi’ or ‘boingo hotspot’) to the casual observer. It allows the attacker to lure unsuspecting WiFi users into connect to their malicious access point instead of presumably safer access points.
There is a malicious WiFi device in your immediate area. You should discontinue use of WiFi until further notice
Warning:Evil AP in your immediate area

Uh, you ok?
To get a better score, you should routinely delete networks you don\'t connect to anymore
To improve this score, try to connect to networks with at least WPA2 encryption
To improve this score, try to connect to networks with at least WPA2 encryption
Networks you connect to often should be strongly encrypted. To improve this score, choose better favorites
Confirmed connection to malicious network. To improve this score, ensure that you routinely remove networks you no longer need, use VPNs and don\'t connect to open networks
